bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

text.body:
FILE No. 5342
In the District Court of the Third Judicial District holding terms at Seattle King County, Wash. Territory.
In the matter of the application of Alexander Brown and George Brown, infants, } No. by their father Nicholas Petition Brown for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon. R.A. Jones, Judge of the above entitled Court:
The petition of Alexander Brown and George Brown, infants, by their father Nicholas Brown, respectfully shows:
1. That Alexander Brown an infant about 4 years old, and George Brown an infant about 2 years old, the children of said Nicholas Brown are now restrained of their liberty at a place known as /// in Skagit County, Washington Territory by on
Olive Brown the mother of said infrants and the wife of said Nicholas Brown.
2. That the alleged cause or pretense of restraint of said infants according to the best knowledge and belief of the petitioner said Nicholas Brown is that she the said Olive Brown claims to have a legal right to the care and custody of said infant children.
3. That the said restraint of said infant children is illegal in this, to wit: That the said Olive Brown, mother of said infants, did, on the 15th day of May 1887, at the City of Seattle, Wash T. leave the house and home of said Nicholas Brown her husband, without his consent and without any /// or cause whatsoever; that the said Olive Brown on said 13th day of May 1887, tolf her said husband that she would leave
his house and home and that she would not live with him here after and /// restrain away from him together with said infants; that said Olive Brown on said 15th day of May 1887, left the bed and board/// of said Nicholas Brown and took with her Alexander Brown and George Brown the infant children aforesaid without the consent of her said husband said Nicholas Brown; that said Olive Brown took said infant children with her to the aforesaid place in Skagit County, and does now restrain them of their liberty and refuses to give them to said Nicholas Brown the father of said children; that
